channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Semaglutide may silence the food noise in your head
item.description: People taking semaglutide report far fewer obsessive thoughts about food, with cravings dropping sharply and mental health improving. This new researc...

item.title: Ozempic, Wegovy and Mounjaro makes food taste sweeter and saltier, and that may quiet cravings

item.title: Strange signals at absolute zero hint at dark matter’s secrets
item.description: QROCODILE has set record-breaking sensitivity in the search for dark matter, detecting signals at energy levels once thought impossible. These results...

item.title: Why so many young kids with ADHD are getting the wrong treatment
item.description: Preschoolers with ADHD are often given medication right after diagnosis, against medical guidelines that recommend starting with behavioral therapy. L...

item.title: Strange ‘leopard spots’ in a Mars rock could be the strongest hint of life yet
item.description: NASA’s Perseverance rover has delivered its most compelling clue yet in the search for life on Mars. A rock sample called “Sapphire Canyon,” taken fro...
